extendedIngredients.name: cole slaw mix
extendedIngredients.originalString: 16 ounce bag cole slaw mix (or 5 cups shredded cabbage)

extendedIngredients.name: granny smith apple
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 Granny Smith apple, peeled, cored & chopped

extendedIngredients.name: green onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 green onions, thinly sliced (white and green parts)

extendedIngredients.name: green peas
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup green peas, fresh or frozen

extendedIngredients.name: red bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ red bell pepper, thinly sliced and cut into 1-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: roasted peanuts
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup roasted salted peanuts, coarsely chopped

recipes.title: Thai Peanut Cabbage Slaw

winePairing.pairingText: Riesling, Gewurztraminer, and Chenin Blanc are great choices for Asian. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. One wine you could try is Chateau Ste. Michelle Cold Creek Vineyard Riesling. It has 4.2 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 15 dollars.

productMatches.title: Chateau Ste. Michelle Cold Creek Vineyard Riesling
productMatches.description: The Cold Creek Riesling is made from 40-year-old vines which contribute fruit intensity and concentration. This is a ripe, lush style of Riesling with aromas of ripe peaches, dried apricots and spice notes. It displays beautiful ripe fruit flavors with a crisp finish.

recipes.instructions: 1. Puree all of the dressing ingredients in a blender or food processor (the consistency will be like applesauce); set aside.2. In a large bowl, toss together all of the coleslaw ingredients. Pour the dressing over the coleslaw ingredients and mix until all of the coleslaw is evenly coated with dressing. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Leftovers can be kept in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

steps.step: Puree all of the dressing ingredients in a blender or food processor (the consistency will be like applesauce); set aside.2. In a large bowl, toss together all of the coleslaw ingredients.

Pour the dressing over the coleslaw ingredients and mix until all of the coleslaw is evenly coated with dressing. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Leftovers can be kept in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
